definition: to agree on sth (after discussion)/to conclude a bargain/to arrange/to promise/to stipulate/to make an appointment/stipulated (time, amount, quality etc)/an arrangement/a deal/appointment/undertaking/commitment/understanding/engagement/stipulation
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
established by popular usage (idiom); common usage agreement/customary convention
according to agreement/as arranged/as stipulated
committed information rate (Frame Relay)/CIR
pinyin: yue1 ding4 zi1 xun4 su4 lu:4

definition: unless otherwise agreed

sentences.english: Make a commitment to turning off the TV and spending some quality time with your loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 约定好关掉电视机，与家人共渡一段高质量的时光。

sentences.english: It is up to the modeling team to establish conventions of model organization and interdependency.
sentences.chinese: 这取决于建模团队建立模型管理和相互依赖的约定。

sentences.english: And they were glad, and covenanted to give him money.
sentences.chinese: 他们欢喜，就约定给他银子。

sentences.english: The cause stipulated in the partnership agreement arises.
sentences.chinese: 发生合伙协议约定的事由。

sentences.english: This term will also be written in the tri-party agreement which will be signed later as required.
sentences.chinese: 该条款也将在随后要求签订的三方协议中予以约定。

sentences.english: When the day arrived, the headman assembled all the villagers and led them into the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 到了约定时日，大臣召集全部村民，带入丛林。

sentences.english: This lets you follow the naming convention that best fits your application.
sentences.chinese: 这允许您遵循最适合您的应用程序的命名约定。

sentences.english: Personally, I agree with the suggested conventions.
sentences.chinese: 就个人来讲，我同意所提议的约定。

sentences.english: A contract founded on a disgraceful consideration or against good morals is null.
sentences.chinese: 基于不道德的约定或违反公序良俗的契约无效。

sentences.english: Shall we proceed with the plan as agreed?
sentences.chinese: 我们应照约定进行计划吗？

sentences.english: I want to play that convention you played with Monique .
sentences.chinese: 我要打你和莫尼克用的约定叫。

sentences.english: Love the original is the most fragrant coffee, agreed to accompany you in my heart forever.
sentences.chinese: 爱情原来是最香浓的咖啡杯，在心里约定陪你到永远。

sentences.english: HR manager and i have appointed to a interview at tomorrow morning.
sentences.chinese: 人事处经理与我约定明天上午面谈。

sentences.english: They agreed to say hello to each other every day through QQ, later XuSong crush on music.
sentences.chinese: 他们约定每天通过QQ彼此问好，后来许嵩迷上音乐。

sentences.english: Let's tentatively say next Wednesday at four o'clock p.m..
sentences.chinese: 我们暂时约定下星期三下午四点。

sentences.english: Anything unstated herein shall be subject to a supplementary agreement entered into both Parties.
sentences.chinese: 未尽事宜，由甲乙双方另行签订补充协议予以约定。

definition: to conclude (treaty, contract, agreement etc)/to set up (a rule etc)
to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
to promise/to undertake to do something/commitment
to agree to and sign (a treaty etc)
to fulfill (one's obligations)/to carry out (a task)/to implement (an agreement)/to perform
agreement/pact/protocol/CL:項|项[xiang4]
time limit/deadline/allotted time
contract/protocol
down payment/advance payment
to consult with/to talk things over/agreement
to sign (a contract, treaty etc)
to state explicitly in writing/to specify/to stipulate
provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
duty/obligation/CL:項|项[xiang4]/volunteer (work etc)
agreement/accord/to reach an agreement
to renege/to go back (on a deal)/to back out (of a promise)
